title: Rodgers plans to sign with Steelers, sources say
content: Aaron Rodgers plans to sign with the Steelers, sources told ESPN, uniting the future Hall of Famer with a team that desperately needs a QB.

title: QB Wilson a mentor for all Giants, not just Dart
content: Russell Wilson's job description with the New York Giants doesn't say anything about being a mentor to rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart. That doesn't mean he won't be one, naturally.

title: D-backs score 7 in 9th to rally past reeling Braves
content: The Diamondbacks, trailing 10-4, rallied with seven runs in the ninth inning to complete a three-game sweep of the Braves, who have lost 11 of their last 14.

title: Colts QB Richardson sidelined with shoulder injury
content: Colts quarterback Anthony Richardson, in the midst of a quarterback battle with veteran Daniel Jones, has aggravated the right shoulder joint he injured in 2023 and will be sidelined for an undetermined length of time, coach Shane Steichen said Thursday.

title: Ishbia in line to take over ChiSox from Reinsdorf
content: Billionaire private equity investor Justin Ishbia is in line to take over ownership of the White Sox from Jerry Reinsdorf, the team said in a release.

title: Lions' St. Brown eyes training camp after surgery
content: Lions All-Pro receiver Amon-Ra St. Brown expects to be "good to go" for training camp after undergoing offseason knee surgery to "clean some stuff up," he said Thursday.

title: Mets' Lindor out with fractured toe, not put on IL
content: Mets shortstop Francisco Lindor broke his right pinky toe when he was hit by a pitch Wednesday but is not expected to land on the injured list, at least for now.

title: Retired Carr: Couldn't 'just take' Saints' money
content: To deal with a significant shoulder injury, surgery was considered an option, as was trying to play through it, but former Saints quarterback Derek Carr says he ultimately didn't feel right with either possibility.

title: Storybook closes: Gauff crushes Boisson in semis
content: Coco Gauff reached her second final at Roland Garros by beating Loïs Boisson 6-1, 6-2 Thursday to end the surprising run by the French wild-card entry.

title: ⚽ Top 100 men's soccer players in the world
content: It's that time again: with the UEFA Champions League final behind us and the 2024-25 season officially over, it's time to rank the top 100 players in the world of men's soccer right now. Welcome to the FC 100.

title: The two quotes that explain everything about the Pacers-Thunder matchup
content: What's fueling the Pacers and Thunder? The NBA Finals matchup can be understood through these two quotes.

title: 'The Game 1 collapse was insane': What led the Knicks to fire Tom Thibodeau
content: Despite back-to-back 50-win seasons, whispers about Tom Thibodeau's future in New York had percolated for months.

title: What it's like in the Rockies' clubhouse as they barrel toward the wrong kind of history
content: Colorado has made headlines for all the wrong reasons so far, but the Rockies aren't giving up just yet.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers or Tigers No. 1 this week?
content: While baseball's powerhouses battle for the top spot, two contenders continue their fall down our list.

title: How drug cartel wars led coach Gerry Glasco to Texas Tech: 'Nothing about softball is scary to me'
content: Facing elimination in the 2025 WCWS is not a problem for Texas Tech coach Gerry Glasco after what he has seen.

title: Oilers win a thriller: Grades for both teams, what to watch in Game 2
content: Edmonton strikes first in the 2025 Stanley Cup Final. Here's how it happened and what comes next Friday.

title: How members of the Pasadena Run Club are finding salvation in a post-wildfire world
content: Though still reeling from the Eaton fire, a group of L.A. area runners are determined to build a worthwhile future.

title: Ranking every WNBA team's roster core, 1-13: Which team has the best young players?
content: Let's stack every WNBA team's core by the youth of its roster, leading off with the Fever and Caitlin Clark.

title: Power Rankings: Dream ride four-game winning streak to move up in Week 3 edition
content: Las Vegas, Washington and Chicago join Atlanta as risers as the league begins Commissioner's Cup play.

title: The Paul George Trade is about to deliver an NBA title
content: The Thunder and the Pacers can trace their superstars and their cores back to trades involving the nine-time All-Star wing.

title: Is Novak Djokovic a real contender for the French Open title?
content: He defeated No. 3 Zverev in the quarterfinals -- but can Djokovic continue this level? In his way stands Sinner, and likely Alcaraz too.

title: Preview: Top storylines, prospects and major leaguers for all teams
content: Breaking down the top storylines for supers and the top prospects and current major leaguers for all 16 teams.

title: Ranking the top 64 NHL draft prospects, including projected ceilings and floors
content: There is no hockey left to be played this season for the top players available June 27-28. Here's how they stack up.

title: Barcelona keep or dump: What do Yamal & Co. need to build on success?
content: Barcelona returned to the top of LaLiga under new coach Hansi Flick. What moves should they make to avoid a step back in 2025-26?

title: Palmer handed Mudryk's No. 10 shirt at Chelsea
content: Cole Palmer has been handed Mykhailo Mudryk's No. 10 shirt at Chelsea, the club confirmed on Thursday.

title: Willian: Chelsea's Estêvão has potential of Yamal
content: Former Chelsea winger Willian believes new signing Estêvão could be as good as Lamine Yamal and can help the club win titles again for years to come.

title: Ronaldo fires Portugal past Germany to NL final
content: Cristiano Ronaldo scored the winner as Portugal fought back to beat Germany 2-1 on Wednesday and reach the Nations League final.

title: Report: Brailsford to scale back Man United role
content: Manchester United's football operations are undergoing yet more change with Dave Brailsford scaling back his role, a source told The Associated Press.

title: USMNT's Steffen (knee) set to miss Gold Cup
content: Zack Steffen injured a knee and became the second goalkeeper dropped from the United States' training camp ahead of the Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Ancelotti: Brazil need Vini to replicate Madrid form
content: Brazil must help striker Vinicius Jr rediscover the form he has displayed at Real Madrid, new national team coach Carlo Ancelotti said on Wednesday.

title: Delap joins Chelsea from Ipswich in $40.6m deal
content: Chelsea have bolstered their forward line with the signing of 22-year-old striker Liam Delap from Ipswich Town.

title: Finland mistakenly call up retired 51-year-old
content: Finland women's national team manager has apologised for mistakenly calling up a long-retired 51-year-old for this week's game against Serbia.

title: 'I have a lot to prove': Broncos' Bo Nix striving to up his game after successful rookie season
content: Nix led all rookies in touchdown passes and got the Broncos to the playoffs, but he knows the NFL will be ready for him in Year 2.

title: 'Like John Wayne': To succeed at Western Kentucky, Tyson Helton seeks gunslingers
content: The coach knows he's going to lose players each year to power conference programs. He's finding ways to win anyway.

title: Pacers, Thunder is latest NBA Finals matchup that includes long championship drought
content: This year is the second NBA Finals in which both participants are on title droughts that exceed 40 years.

title: Buxton goes 20/20? Rockies bats rebound in a big way? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Meet the 2025 Boxing Hall of Fame class: Pacquiao, Paz, more
content: All you need to know about Manny Pacquiao, Michael Nunn, Mary Jo Sanders, Vinny Paz and the rest of this year's class.

title: 'Really big bomb': Musk alleges Trump named in Epstein files; says ‘truth will come out’
content: Elon Musk and Donald Trump's feud intensifies. Musk claims Trump is linked to the Jeffrey Epstein case. He suggests this is why the files remain sealed. This follows disagreements over a new tax bill. Trump says he cut Musk out of EV policy decisions. Musk retorts that Trump's election win needed his support.

title: Central portal for waqf properties to be launched today
content: Minority Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju defends the upcoming 'UMEED' Central Portal for waqf properties, asserting its legality and alignment with the Constitution. He dismisses concerns raised by the All India Muslim Personal Law Board, emphasizing the portal's role in enhancing waqf management through accountability and transparency.

title: $100 billion wiped out! Tesla shares crash 17% after Musk-Trump spat
content: Tesla shares plummeted as tensions flared between Elon Musk and Donald Trump after Musk criticized Trump's tax bill. Trump retaliated, accusing Musk of souring their relationship due to the removal of EV tax incentives. This political fallout has impacted Tesla's sales and brought scrutiny to Musk's other ventures, contributing to a significant drop in Tesla's stock value.

title: Ministers, officials won’t be able to modify rooms, office spaces at new CCS buildings
content: Prime Minister Modi has urged ministers and officers to refrain from modifying their offices in the new ministry buildings along Kartavya Path, discouraging linking status to allocated space. This directive precedes the government's planned shift of ministries to the Common Central Secretariat, aiming to curb frequent renovations and save public funds.

title: This is likely Elon Musk’s ‘Most Read’ tweet on Donald Trump
content: Elon Musk and Donald Trump's public feud intensifies as Musk claims Trump's election victory wouldn't have been possible without his support. Musk accused Trump of "ingratitude" after Trump expressed disappointment in Musk's criticism of the "One Big Beautiful Bill." Trump alleged Musk only developed a problem when he found out Trump would cut the EV mandate, further fueling the dispute.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Seemanth Kumar Singh appointed new Bengaluru commissione
content: Following a tragic stampede at RCB's victory celebration in Bengaluru, which resulted in eleven fatalities, CM Siddaramaiah swiftly appointed Seemanth Kumar Singh as the new commissioner. Several top police officials, including Commissioner B Dayananda, were suspended with immediate effect due to the incident.

title: AI killing jobs: Google AI CEO Hassabis has a tip; If I were a student..
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: CSK fan club's 2024 warning goes viral after stampede at RCB IPL 2025 celebration
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru won the IPL in 2025. Celebrations turned deadly due to a stampede. A prior warning from a Chennai Super Kings fan club resurfaced. The warning highlighted safety issues at Chinnaswamy Stadium. RCB announced financial aid for the victims' families. The incident sparked debate on fan safety and event management. Over fifty people sustained injuries during the stampede.

title: ‘Her laptop is still on office table’: Bengaluru techie dream ends in grief
content: Devi, a devoted RCB fan from Tamil Nadu working in Bengaluru, eagerly sought permission to attend the team's victory parade. Despite missing online ticket availability, she optimistically headed to the stadium. Tragically, her friends received a call from the hospital, marking the last communication and leaving them with the heartbreaking task of informing her parents.

title: Tharoor vs Tharoor: What happened when Cong leader met his son; watch
content: In a surprising moment, Shashi Tharoor was questioned by his son, Ishaan Tharoor of the Washington Post, during a foreign policy address. Ishaan inquired about evidence of Pakistan's involvement in the Pahalgam attack. Tharoor responded that India possessed convincing evidence before conducting Operation Sindoor. He highlighted Pakistan's history of denying involvement in terror attacks, citing the Mumbai attacks.

title: War twist: Ukraine used open-source software in Russia drone attack
content: ArduPilot, an open-source software initially created for hobbyist drones, has reportedly been used in a Ukrainian attack that destroyed a portion of Russia's strategic bomber fleet. The software's creators expressed surprise at its military application, as it was originally designed for peaceful purposes like search and rescue and autonomous vehicles.

title: 'The true definition of a son': NBA legend Allen Iverson shares post on his son
content: Allen Iverson recently shared a heartfelt Instagram post praising his son, Isaiah Rahsaan Iverson, highlighting his admirable qualities and expressing immense pride. This follows a previous dedication to his ex-wife, Tawanna Turner, showcasing their past together. Despite facing financial struggles post-retirement, Iverson's life is seemingly improving with a new role at Reebok.

title: ‘Electric cars that nobody else wanted…’: Trump’s shocking words on Musk
content: A public feud has erupted between Donald Trump and Elon Musk over a government tax bill, leading to Trump claiming he asked Musk to leave his advisory role and revoked EV mandates. Musk has vehemently criticized the bill, while Trump has voiced his disappointment and threatened to terminate Musk's government contracts.

title: India-US deal momentum builds: Goyal says interim pact may be reached soon
content: The United States and India are actively engaged in negotiations for a bilateral trade agreement, with the goal of finalizing an interim deal by the end of June. Discussions are progressing positively, with additional US officials expected to join the talks soon.

title: Connor Brown showers praises on Oilers teammates
content: Edmonton Oilers' Connor Brown is blogging for the NHL during the Stanley Cup Final. Following their Game 1 victory against the Florida Panthers, Brown expressed his excitement and lauded teammates Leon Draisaitl, Sam Bennett, and Mattias Ekholm for their outstanding performances. Additionally, he also shared the deep connection that his team shares, and his belief that they would take home the Stanley Cup.

title: Gambhir makes strong statement on B'luru stampede, RCB celebrations
content: Gautam Gambhir expressed his condolences for the lives lost in the Bengaluru stampede during RCB's IPL victory celebrations, advocating for responsible celebrations and suggesting stadium events instead of roadshows. Shubman Gill was announced as the new Test captain as India prepares for a five-match Test series against England, marking the start of their ICC World Test Championship 2025-27 campaign.

title: Watch: New footage of Ukraine's drone strike in Russia reveal full extent of devastation
content: Ukraine's Security Service (SBU) executed 'Operation Spider’s Web,' a covert drone strike deep inside Russia, reportedly damaging 41 warplanes across four air bases. President Zelenskyy hailed the 18-month operation as historic, claiming it hit 34% of Russia's strategic missile carriers. The SBU released video evidence of the FPV drone attacks, launched from hidden compartments in trucks near the airfields.

title: ‘I don’t like women who ... ’: BJP minister makes bizarre remark
content: Madhya Pradesh minister Kailash Vijayvargiya sparked controversy with his remarks about women's clothing, stating he dislikes women who wear revealing clothes and refuses to take photos with them. This isn't the first time he's made such comments, having previously compared women in "bad dresses" to a demoness from the Ramayana.

title: Are banks and stock market open or closed on June 6 & 7? Check what's open for Bakrid
content: Eid al-Adha is anticipated to be celebrated in India on June 7, potentially marking a public holiday with closures for schools, colleges, and government offices. Banks will observe closures on June 6 in Thiruvananthapuram and Kochi, with varied operations on June 7 across different cities. Stock markets (NSE & BSE) will remain open, while digital banking services will continue uninterrupted.

title: Eid al-Adha 2025: Best Eid Mubarak messages for friends, family on Bakrid
content: The festival takes place on the tenth day of Dhul Hijjah, the final month in the Islamic lunar calendar, which begins with the sighting of the crescent moon. The holy day is dedicated to joy, prayer, and sharing blessings with loved ones. As Eid-al-Adha is set to be celebrated on June 7 in India, sending warm wishes and heartfelt messages to those around you is a beautiful way to express your love and good wishes

title: 'Hope she learnt a lesson': Sharmistha Panoli's father after her bail
content: Sharmistha Panoli, a law student, was granted interim bail by the Calcutta High Court after being arrested for a video allegedly hurting religious sentiments. Her father acknowledged disapproving of some of her social media content and revealed her health issues. The court mandated she surrender her passport and cooperate with the investigation, also ordering police protection due to threats.

title: Meghalaya murder: 'I was killed', say posters at honeymooner's funeral
content: Raja Raghuvanshi was discovered murdered in Meghalaya, and his wife, Sonam, is still missing, prompting allegations of a botched investigation. The family is demanding a CBI probe and Army assistance, claiming local police are not taking the case seriously.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir drops massive playing XI hint, backs experienced batter
content: Gautam Gambhir has strongly hinted at Karun Nair's inclusion in the playing XI for the upcoming England Test series, emphasizing the importance of rewarding players with consistent performances. Nair's impressive domestic form, including a double century against England Lions, coupled with Gambhir's backing, makes his selection at Headingley increasingly probable.

title: Will Bumrah play all five Tests? Gambhir drops major hint
content: Gautam Gambhir revealed that a decision on how many Test matches Jasprit Bumrah will play in the upcoming series against England is yet to be made, emphasizing discussions with Bumrah will determine his availability based on the series' progress. Shubman Gill is set to lead India in the five-Test series, marking the start of their World Test Championship campaign.

title: Brittany Mahomes scores big as KC Current’s value explodes to $275 million
content: The Kansas City Current, co-owned by Brittany Mahomes, has seen its valuation soar to $275 million, a 266% increase, making it a top NWSL team. This growth is attributed to investments in the CPKC Stadium, a dedicated training facility, and strategic ownership. The Current's success reflects the rising popularity of women's sports, marked by increased attendance and media attention.

title: Bengaluru stampede: FIR filed against RCB, event organisers
content: Bengaluru Police have filed an FIR against the RCB franchise, DNA Entertainment Networks, and the KSCA Administrative Committee following the tragic stampede on Wednesday that resulted in 11 fatalities. The FIR, registered at Cubbon Park Police Station, cites criminal negligence.

title: Drones, K9 units: Post-Pahalgam attack, a full-spectrum shield for Amarnath Yatra
content: Ahead of the Amarnath Yatra, the government is implementing heightened security measures, deploying 581 CAPF companies, jammers, drones, and K9 units. Scheduled from July 3 to August 9, the pilgrimage will see signal jammers used for convoy protection against IED threats. Security forces will be stationed along the Pahalgam and Baltal routes, utilizing ROPs, QATs, BDS, and advanced surveillance technologies.

title: IND tour of ENG: Gambhir speaks on Shreyas Iyer omission, says 'anyone can be called if ... '
content: India's Test team sees a generational shift as Shubman Gill captains the side in England, with Rishabh Pant as his deputy. Karun Nair makes a comeback after eight years, highlighting domestic performance. Despite a strong IPL season, Shreyas Iyer misses out due to intense competition, as meritocracy drives selection decisions.

title: Is Elon Musk coming to India? Errol Musk on possibility of Tesla CEO's investment plan
content: Amidst speculation about Tesla's India entry, Errol Musk, Elon's father, hinted at a future visit from the tech mogul, emphasizing the need for discretion due to his global impact. He assured that Elon sees promise in India, particularly for expanding Starlink's rural internet connectivity.

title: 'Madam N': How Pakistani woman lured Indian influencers to turn spies
content: Noshaba Shehzad, a Pakistani businesswoman, is accused of running an ISI-backed spy ring in India, using her travel agency to recruit influencers and facilitate covert operations. She allegedly exploited religious pilgrimages and manipulated visa processes with the help of Pakistani officials to funnel funds and operatives into India.

title: Shocking! Chahal played IPL with 3 fractures, RJ Mahvash reveals
content: Amidst dating rumors, RJ Mahvash lauded Yuzvendra Chahal's unwavering dedication during IPL 2025. Despite suffering three fractures, including fractured ribs and a bowling finger, the leg-spinner played the entire season for Punjab Kings. Mahvash highlighted Chahal's warrior spirit and the team's resilience, even in their narrow final defeat against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

title: Watch: After Ayodhya visit, Elon Musk’s father offers prayers at ISKCON Temple
content: Errol Musk, father of Elon Musk, visited the ISKCON Temple in New Delhi, engaging in rituals and prayers amidst chants. This spiritual visit followed his trip to Ayodhya, where he praised the Ram temple and the kindness of the Indian people. Musk is in India to explore green technology with Servotech, balancing business with cultural immersion.

title: Big boost for Make In India: Dassault ties up with Tata to build Rafale parts
content: Tata Advanced Systems will manufacture Rafale fighter aircraft fuselages in India, marking the first production of these components outside France. This collaboration with Dassault Aviation involves establishing an advanced manufacturing facility in Hyderabad.

title: 'I'm done living': Techie jumps to death from 21st floor in Pune
content: In a tragic incident in Pune's Hinjawadi area, a 25-year-old IT professional, Abhilasha Bhausaheb Kothimbhire, ended her life by jumping from the 21st floor of a building. Arriving at the Crown Green Society early morning, she visited a friend before taking the extreme step. A suicide note revealed her despair and apologies to her parents and friends for her decision.

title: ‘I didn't ask for it but ... ’: Susan reveals Modi's surprise letter; what PM wrote to chess legend
content: Chess legend Susan Polgar appreciates Prime Minister Narendra Modi's encouragement of Indian chess talent. She recalls receiving a letter from him. This recognized her work with young players. PM Modi also congratulated D Gukesh on defeating Magnus Carlsen. Gukesh later won against Arjun Erigaisi. Hikaru Nakamura then defeated Gukesh. Nakamura tied with Gukesh in third position at Norway Chess.

title: The best, worst and wildest U.S. soccer kits outside MLS, NWSL
content: Without leaguewide kit deals, U.S. soccer's lower-league clubs are making their mark with eye-catching shirts.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Ten Hag to give Antony a Man United escape route at Leverkusen
content: New Bayer Leverkusen coach Erik ten Hag is ready to make a move for Manchester United forward Antony. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Top 25 regardless of class: Ranking the best players of 2026, 2027 and 2028
content: How do the best of the 2026, 2027 and 2028 classes stack up against each other? Let's rank the top 25 players.

title: Odds, post positions for the Belmont Stakes
content: Preakness winner Journalism and Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty have the best odds in the eight-horse field for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

title: 'Lives more important': WC-winning captain on RCB's celebrations, stampede
content: Kapil Dev expressed his sorrow over the tragic deaths of 11 fans during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations, emphasizing that lives are more valuable than celebrations and urging better safety measures for future events. He also wished the Indian team success in their upcoming Test tour of England, highlighting the importance of teamwork.

title: LeBron James’ wife reveals how being a teenage mother impacted her sense of identity
content: Savannah James, wife of LeBron James, recently shared her experiences with motherhood on the podcast 'Everybody’s Crazy,' revealing how it shaped her identity. She admitted struggling to find herself outside of being a mom, especially with her sons.

title: How B'luru stampede became one of Indian cricket's worst fan disasters
content: Celebrations turned tragic in Bengaluru as a stampede at Chinnaswamy Stadium claimed 11 lives following RCB's IPL victory. Thousands gathered for a victory parade, overwhelming security near Gate 7. The Karnataka government has announced compensation for the victims' families and ordered an inquiry. Police officials had warned about the risks of holding the parade at short notice.

title: Musk Fires Back After Trump's "Disappointed" Remark, Slams "Ingratitude"
content: 'Very disappointed, don't know if we will have a good relationship anymore': Trump after Musk criticises bill

title: "Easiest Way To Save Money": Trump Threatens To Cut Musk's Contracts
content: US President Donald Trump threatened to cut Elon Musk's government contracts as their fractured alliance rapidly escalated into a public feud Thursday.

title: Man Dragged For Several Km After Car Rams Couple In Bihar
content: A 60-year-old man and his wife who were sitting by the roadside were killed after a car hit them in Bihar's Saharsa district, police said on Thursday.

title: Passport Damaged In Probe Agency ED Fire, Maharashtra Minister Allowed To Extend Foreign Trip
content: A special court has allowed Maharashtra minister Chhagan Bhujbal and his son Pankaj to extend their international travel, considering that their passports got damaged due to a fire at the Enforcement Directorate's Mumbai office in April.

title: Bharat Mata Portrait At Kerala Raj Bhavan Sparks Row, Minister Skips Event
content: Kerala Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar on Thursday said there would be no compromise on the presence of Bharat Mata's portrait at the Raj Bhavan.

title: "That Shouldn't Be Allowed": Shashi Tharoor's Quip After Son Asks Question In US
content: Shashi Tharoor made it clear at the outset that the person questioning him at the press conference is his son, Ishan Tharoor, adding with a big smile that "it shouldn't be allowed".

title: "Go Electric, Go Now" Message From G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant To Tackle Delhi Pollution
content: Delhi becomes unlivable for three months a year, noted G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant, underlining the severe economic and health burden of air pollution.

title: 'Understanding Among Parties After Pahalgam Attack Should Continue': RSS Chief
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Thursday said the mutual understanding displayed by the political class following the Pahalgam terror attack and action taken by India later should continue and become a permanent feature.

title: Video: Nripendra Misra Gives NDTV Exclusive Tour Of New Portion Of Ram Temple
content: The pending rituals of the Ayodhya Ram temple following its completion, and consecration of the other temple complexes in the perimeter, took place with grand ceremonies on Wednesday and Thursday.

title: Hours After Siddaramaiah Suspended Bengaluru Top Cop, New Chief Appointed
content: Senior IPS officer Seemanth Kumar Singh was on Thursday posted as Bengaluru Police Commissioner until further orders, an official notification said.

title: Trump Says It Might Be Better To Let Ukraine, Russia "Fight For A While"
content: President Donald Trump said Thursday that it might be better to let Ukraine and Russia "fight for a while" before pulling them apart and pursuing peace.

title: Trump-Musk Relationship Flames Out Just As It Started: Intensely And Publicly
content: The breakup between the president of the United States and the world's richest man is unfurling much like their relationship started - rapidly, intensely and very publicly.

title: Swift Action Averted Stampede During RCB Win Celebration In Hyderabad: Cops
content: A potential stampede was averted through swift and firm action after celebrations over Royal Challengers Bengaluru's maiden IPL title turned unruly near the state Secretariat on the night of June 3, said the Hyderabad police.

title: "Only Took One": 5 Boys Paraded Naked For Stealing Chocolate In Bihar
content: Five children were forced to strip naked, tied to each other with a rope and were paraded in full public view in a market as a punishment in a Bihar village. They were also garlanded with slippers. Their crime? They stole a chocolate bar from a shop.

title: Trump, Xi Hold Telephone Talks, Agree To Continue Negotiations To Reach Trade Deal
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping and his US counterpart Donald Trump had lengthy talks over phone on Thursday to iron out differences over their tit-for-tat tariffs and agreed to have more talks between their trade representatives.

title: Muzaffarpur Rape Accused Surrenders After 'Bulldozer Action' Against Home, Eatery In Bihar
content: In a dramatic turn of events in the Muzaffarpur Dalit girl case, the main accused, Mukesh Kumar Rai, surrendered before the police after the district administration demolished his house and eatery (dhaba) on Thursday.

title: Rape Accused Brought To UP Court For Hearing, Escapes From Custody
content: A man accused of rape gave police personnel the slip and escaped from court premises in eastern Uttar Pradesh's Deoria district on Thursday.

title: Tourists Airlifted From North Sikkim As Rescue Ops Continue In Phases
content: Nearly 1,500 tourists were stranded in the popular North Sikkim destinations of Lachen and Lachung after the Phidang bridge -considered the region's lifeline - was severely damaged.

title: Trump Learns Lessons From First 'Muslim Ban' But Raises New Questions
content: In banning most travel to the United States by citizens of 12 countries, President Donald Trump is fine-tuning a playbook popular with his base, even as his singling out of particular nations left many scratching their heads.

title: Trinamool's Mahua Moitra Marries Ex-MP Pinaki Misra In Germany
content: Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Mahua Moitra has married senior advocate and former BJD MP Pinaki Misra in Germany.

title: We pitched trade offers for three NFL stars
content: quarterback Kirk Cousins didn't show up to start of OTAs last week . the Dolphins' front office has made it clear it's looking to trade cornerback Jalen Ramsey . we asked four analysts and experts to craft realistic trade offers for all three players .

title: Why are there so few women coaches in professional tennis?
content: her career came to an end in 2017 at the age of 25 . she was asked if she could temporarily help as she returned to the tour . but months turned into years, and she was hailed as a professional tennis player .

title: 'India won't talk to Pak …': Tharoor-led delegation meets VP Vance

title: New season, new division challengers: Ranking the NFL’s most likely worst-to-first teams
content: 25 teams have gone from worst to first in their division in a single season . the Texans are a recent example . there are clear indicators that help guide us as to which teams are most likely to go from best to first .

title: B'luru stampede: CID to probe; top cop suspended - K'taka govt cracks whip
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Thunder vs. Pacers: Who has the NBA Finals edge according to NBA 2K25?
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder and Indiana Pacers are the team's strongest suits . a look at how NBA 2K25 rates the two contenders . the Thunder's bid for the title is led by newly-crowned MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander .

title: Dave Roberts jokingly gives Shohei Ohtani remote-controlled car for his daughter
content: Dave Roberts and his wife bought a pink remote-controlled electronic Porsche for Ohtani's daughter . the two often share jokes and that this gift is a "little bit of a joke" but a sincere one . "this is going to be your daughter's first car," he says .

title: UFC 316 expert picks, best bets: How can O'Malley take back Dvalishvili's title?
content: Sean O'Malley takes on titleholder merab Dvalishvili at uFC 316 on saturday (10 p.m. ET on ESPN PPV) this is O'malley's first fight since the loss . Julianna Pea puts her women's bantamweight title on the line .

title: Justis Huni: Fabio Wardley's home crowd won't scare me -- my house was shot up
content: justis Huni has bided his time for a fight he says will "change his life" if he beats Fabio Wardley (19-0-1, 17 KOs) the australian was a replacement for Jarrell Miller, stepping up on six weeks' notice . he has settled in blackpool in the northwest of England for training camp .

title: Twins turn to David Festa in wake of Pablo Lopez injury
content: our fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . a couple of the 13 games may see a sprinkle or two, but they are all supposed to play without a hitch .

title: The 20 rookies you should draft in fantasy football
content: the focus is on redraft formats in 10-team PPR leagues . the top 20 rookies are ranked, along with the rounds they should be targeted . it's never too early to start planning for the fantasy season . we are less than 100 days from opening night in Philly .

title: Security forces launch operation along India-Myanmar border in Arunachal Pradesh
content: “While moving through the thick forest, the patrol observed the movement of unknown individuals. In response, the patrol drew heavy and indiscriminate fire from heavy-calibre weapons, which was effectively retaliated by the security forces,” according to the Defence Ministry.

title: Ram Temple moves towards completion, idol of ‘Raja Ram’ consecrated
content: While Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the top government brass and a host of celebrities were present at the consecration of Ram Lalla, the child god, on January 22, 2024, the event this time was quieter

title: Stalin hands over appointment orders to 1,304 forest staff
content: An event to celebrate World Environment Day was organised by the Departments of Environment, Climate Change, and Forests

title: Railways to undertake random verification of Aadhaar to check for illegal immigrants
content: Railway Board has said instances of individuals staying unauthorisedly in India with fake or forged Aadhaar cards and using them as proof of identity for various purposes, including employment and travel, have come to notice

title: Police officers told not to post photos in uniform on social media
content: Move after some officers attended private functions in uniform and even shared sensitive information

title: State to rollout Coco policy soon
content: CM Naidu reviews crop procurement plans; pushes for maintaining global standards in cocoa, mango, and tobacco farming

title: People’s convention demands conservation of KAU’s model jackfruit farm
content: Participants tie ribbons to each jackfruit tree, embrace them, and form human chain of protection, followed by an environmental pledge to preserve the farm

title: Tamil translation of Madhav Gadgil’s autobiography  A Walk Up the Hill launched
content: Prof. Gadgil recalled his long association with Tamil Nadu that began in 1973 when he started work in the Nilgiris and subsequently in Mudumalai Tiger Reserve

title: Clam sector plumbs new depths
content: The Vembanad Lake ecosystem and clam fishery are facing an unprecedented crisis. The deteriorating water quality and plummeting clam production have hit the lives of a large number of people who once survived on clam fishery. Hiran Unnikrishnan and Sam Paul A. find out what is worrying the ecologists as well as fishers of the region

title: Maturity shown by political parties amid Indo-Pak tension should continue to ensure nation’s security, growth: RSS chief
content: Terming conversion as “violence”, RSS Chief says that the Sangh never supports change of religion done out of force or greed, adding that those who want to “come back” must be respected

title: Commissioner failed to reject permission for revelry in writing: Karnataka government
content: The office of Police Commissioner failed to give a written reply to the RCB organisers about rejecting the permission on the grounds of lack of time to prepare for such a huge event, said the suspension order of the Commissioner of Police and four other officers

title: Seemanth Kumar Singh is new Bengaluru city police chief
content: Mr. Singh, presently posted as Additional Director-General of Police, Bengaluru Metropolitan Task Force, will replace B. Dayananda

title: Bengaluru stampede: ‘Everything that could go wrong, went wrong’
content: According to police sources, a perfect storm of circumstances converged to trigger one of the most tragic incidents in the nation’s cricketing history—the Bengaluru stampede

title: Minister of State L. Murugan meets Vietnamese delegation
content: India and Vietnam strengthen media and entertainment cooperation, highlighting deep civilisational connections and strong bilateral relations

title: Girl from tribal community in Kalvarayan Hills earns her seat in IIT
content: A. Rajeshwari,  a student of the Government Tribal Residential Higher Secondary School in Karumandurai, has ranked 417 in the Scheduled Tribe category in JEE (Advanced) 2025

title: MSME parks set to industrialise Andhra Pradesh big time, says Minister Kondapalli Srinivas
content: The government is striving to attract entrepreneurs to invest in the State by offering them tailor-made incentives and extending the required support, and the efforts are paying off, he says

title: Diplomacy is about ‘incrementalism’, says Congress leader Manish Tewari
content: Countering the Opposition party’s criticism of multi-party delegations to global capitals, delegates, including from the Congress, said they had had fruitful meetings with a cross-section of groups

title: M.K. Alagiri’s supporters seek re-entry into DMK
content: DMK president and Chief Minister M.K. Stalin recently visiting his elder brother’s house when he was visiting Madurai in connection with the party’s general council meeting

title: Trinamool leader Anubrata Mondal appears before police; NCW seeks report on abusive audio
content: In the viral audio, Anubrata Mondal is heard making derogatory remarks at a police officer’s wife and mother; despite an FIR registered against Mondal, he has not been arrested

title: Pakistan likes to dangle nuclear bogey to get the world excited, Tharoor says in Washington
content: Congress MP dismisses questions on approaching nuclear threshold during recent India-Pakistan conflict

title: More ‘resources and efforts’ required to nurture India-Central Asia links: S. Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlights the need for intensifying trade through the port of Chabahar in Iran; he further expresses support for ‘mutual settlement of trade’ in national currencies

title: Maharashtra government cancels approvals for 903 projects
content: Schemes that are not operational due to land acquisition issues, local opposition, or lack of cooperation from contractors will be cancelled to prevent misallocation of funds

title: ‘Malai koothu’ has evolved, but there’s not much in the art form for ‘koothadi’
content:
‘Malai koothu’, a form of ‘therukoothu’, is culturally moored in the lives of the Malaiyali tribes of Dharmapuri and the Javadhu
and Yelagiri Hills in Tirupathur. But the artists have to strike a balance between the pleasure of pursuit of an art form that caters to an already poor audience and making a living through other jobs

title: A pillar and a peak that are held most sacred by the Irula tribe
content: Members of this community celebrate the harvest from their millet land in May and June. They perform pujas for five weeks praying to the deity for another good harvest. More recently, the festival has become popular among non-adivasi members too

title: From prison to printing press: legacy of Kudiarasu, first journal Periyar published
content: In the early 1920s, Periyar, a prominent member of the Indian National Congress, was jailed in Coimbatore for leading a protest. There, he envisioned a publication that would speak “unflinching truths to power”. The result was a weekly that became not only a mouthpiece of the Self-Respect Movement but also a platform for challenging social evils

title: Delimitation will address concerns of southern States: Union Home Ministry
content: After Tamil Nadu CM questions timing of Census, MHA attributes delays to the impact of COVID-19, including the disruption to education, as most Census enumerators are government school teachers

title: Old careers continue to remain relevant, say experts
content: At a webinar on ‘Emerging Careers 2030: Why Humanities and Sciences Hold the Key’, speakers stress importance of acquiring inter-disciplinary skills

title: State Highways to construct new bridge across Then Pennar river in Tiruvannamalai
content: Proposal for the new bridge has been sent to the State government for financial clearance as technical study for the project has been completed. The project will be announced by the State government in the coming weeks before tenders were floated for the new bridge

title: PM Modi to inaugurate Kashmir’s first all-weather rail link with Delhi via Katra
content: Vande Bharat service to Srinagar to begin June 7; Chenab and Anji Khad bridges hailed as engineering marvels; ₹46,000 crore worth projects to be launched

title: Vote splitters set to play spoilsport as LDF, UDF clash in Nilambur byelection
content: The contest between UDF’s Aryadan Shoukath and LDF’s M. Swaraj has garnered special attention due to the presence of three other key players: All India Trinamool Congress (TMC) State convener P.V. Anvar, who is contesting as and Independent; BJP’s Mohan George; and Social Democratic Party of India’s (SDPI) Sadik Naduthodi. These candidates can potentially siphon off crucial votes,  impacting the outcome in a closely contested election.

title: Lalu Prasad wants to see his son who failed Class 9 become King of Bihar: Prashant Kishor
content: He made the remark while addressing a public rally in Siwan district; the former political strategist has been touring the State for his Bihar Badalv yatra; after his party garnered 10% votes in the bye-elections last year, Kishor has been trying to position himself as the third political alternative in Bihar

title: Urban cooperative banks in Tiruchi district yet to join UPI system
content: Customers have to visit their respective branches to make payments, thereby causing inconvenience to them and results in loss of precious time for them

title: Two mobile apps, portal to aid in speedy processing of Census 2027 data
content: The two apps — Census 2021-Household and PE-Census 2021 (Population Enumeration) — and the Census Management and Monitoring System, were originally developed for the 2021 Census; apps will be tweaked to include caste data collection

title: 31,221 candidates to appear for Mega DSC exams in combined Nellore
content: The appearing candidates will be allowed to enter the exam centre 90 minutes before the specified time, and they are advised to strictly follow the rules

title: 50% greenery by 2047 under Swarna Andhra Vision: Nellore MP
content: Nellore Collector says Vanamahotsavam has been organised on a large scale with an aim to plant 4.30 lakh saplings across the district

title: Keralite at the helm of the world’s biggest container ship
content: As the world’s largest container vessel MSC Irina is set to berth at Vizhinjam, its captain, a native of Thrissur, says the international port should have materialised much earlier. He sees the port helping the country achieving an ‘economic leap.’

title: Govt. nod for ₹643.88-crore organ transplant institute in Kozhikode
content: The institute is envisaged as an umbrella organisation, which  will bring together scientists, researchers and expert clinicians and coordinate all activities related to organ donation and transplant in the State, including treatment and rehabilitation. The institute will come up on 20 acres at Chevayur in Kozhikode

title: ‘Strict action will be taken against officials failing to implement NREGA effectively’
content: The Zilla Panchayat Chief Executive Officer was chairing an ad hoc committee meeting on the job scheme in Raichur

title: Its a rocky journey for children from Kallakkuttykudy to reach their school
content: The students have to use a temporary bamboo bridge to cross the Nallathanni  river during the rainy season. The original bridge over the river was swept away in the 2018 floods and has not been reconstructed till now

title: Bengaluru stadium tragedy: Grieving families recall the day of horror
content: For many families across Karnataka, the day will now remain etched in memory not for celebration, but for devastating loss
